newsitem.title: USA: Norwest buys $340 mln BankBoston unit.
newsitem.headline: Norwest buys $340 mln BankBoston unit.

text.p: BOSTON, June 23 (Reuter) BankBoston Corp said Monday it agreed to sell its consumer finance subsidiary Fidelity Acceptance Corp to Norwest Corp's subsidiary Norwest Financial Inc for $340 million.
BankBoston projected an after-tax gain of $40 milllion from the transaction, which it expected to close in the third quarter.
Under the deal, Norwest will repay BankBoston $800 million in outstanding debt obligations BankBoston said.
BankBoston bought Fidelity Acceptance in July 1993 as part of its $240 million acquisition of the Society for Savings, a state-chartered savings bank in Connecticut.
BankBoston had a deal in January to sell Fidelity Acceptance Corp to Lake Forest, Ill., based Mercury Finance Co for 32.7 million Mercury shares valued at $458 million when the deal was announced.

But BankBoston terminated the deal three weeks later, after Mercury said it had to restate earnings lower over the past four years because of accounting problems. Mercury's stock subsequently plunged and closed at 2-1/4 on Monday.
